block.p: Sarah Benson Vest, the daughter of Lee Vest Mack of New Canaan, Conn., and the late George G. Vest, is to be married this afternoon to Hassan Youssef Hassan, the son of Noel Fahmy and Youssef Hassan of Alexandria, Egypt. Gail Noble, a justice of the peace of New Canaan, is to officiate at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Charles L. Mack.

The bride, 36, who is known as Sallie, is a geologist for Metcalf & Eddy, an environmental engineering company, working until last month on a water-management project in Gaza. She graduated from Franklin and Marshall College and received a master's degree in geology from Oregon State University. Her father was a partner in Cummings & Lockwood, a law firm in Stamford, Conn. Her mother, who is retired, was an agent at New Canaan Travelworld. The bride's stepfather retired as a vice president for operations at Citibank, in Long Island City, Queens.

Sarah Benson Vest, the daughter of Lee Vest Mack of New Canaan, Conn., and the late George G. Vest, is to be married this afternoon to Hassan Youssef Hassan, the son of Noel Fahmy and Youssef Hassan of Alexandria, Egypt. Gail Noble, a justice of the peace of New Canaan, is to officiate at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Charles L. Mack.

The bride, 36, who is known as Sallie, is a geologist for Metcalf & Eddy, an environmental engineering company, working until last month on a water-management project in Gaza. She graduated from Franklin and Marshall College and received a master's degree in geology from Oregon State University. Her father was a partner in Cummings & Lockwood, a law firm in Stamford, Conn. Her mother, who is retired, was an agent at New Canaan Travelworld. The bride's stepfather retired as a vice president for operations at Citibank, in Long Island City, Queens.

The bridegroom, 36, is the deputy director of the commercial department of the Arabian International Construction Company, in Cairo. He graduated from the University of Alexandria and a received a master's degree in computer science from American University in Cairo. His mother retired as the principal of the Rushdy Secondary School in Alexandria. His father retired as a general in the Egyptian Police Force.
The couple met in Alexandria in 1996, when both worked on a United States Agency for International Development project to improve wastewater treatment.
